'Now or never': Man Utd determine to submit 'crazy offer' to sign Barca's star with £42.8million clause

Posted by Taylor - 29/08/2023 13:48

﻿Marcos Alonso is one of the options being considered by Manchester United to bolster the left back position.

 

The Red Devils have formally sought to recruit the Barcelona player on an initial loan, according to today's edition of Marca (news image given below).

The present contract of the ex-Chelsea defender at the Nou Camp includes a £42.8 million release clause and is set to expire in the summer of 2024.

According to the well-known Spanish media site, Man Utd has offered Alonso a two-year contract, which would include a year on loan and an additional year when his Barca contract finishes.

According to reports, the 32-year-old is considering transferring to Old Trafford because the Blaugrana want Joao Cancelo of Man City to take his place.

The arrangement with the Portuguese international is complete, according to Marca. The 29-year-old is close to joining Barcelona, according to The Guardian.


Before relocating to Spain, Alonso won every significant honor while playing for Chelsea (with the exception of the League Cup).

 The Paris Saint-Germain logo loads official content in 0 of 56 seconds.

He started just 11 of the 24 games he played in during Xavi Hernandez's La Liga championship season last year.

The nine-cap international played the entire 90 minutes in the 4-3 triumph against Villarreal last weekend after warming the bench in the first two games of the season. 

He possesses the skills and knowledge necessary to improve Old Trafford's defensive unit. Should Man United sign Marcos Alonso, in your opinion?﻿﻿﻿
